00081   struct ClassPoint
00082   {
00083       const char *id;
00084       // Specialization points to match, in order: Stealth, Combat, Magic
00085       // Note: Order is taken from http://www.uesp.net/wiki/Morrowind:Class_Quiz
00086       unsigned int points[3];
00087   };

00108     void setMode(GuiMode newMode)
00109     {
00110       if (newMode==GM_Inventory && allowed==GW_None)
00111         return;
00112 
00113       mode = newMode;
00114       updateVisible();
00115     }
00116     void setNextMode(GuiMode newMode);
00117 
00118     GuiMode getMode() const { return mode; }
00119 
00120     bool isGuiMode() const { return getMode() != GM_Game; } // Everything that is not game mode is considered "gui mode"
00121 
00122     // Disallow all inventory mode windows
00123     void disallowAll()
00124     {
00125       allowed = GW_None;
00126       updateVisible();
00127     }
00128 
00129     // Allow one or more windows
00130     void allow(GuiWindow wnd)
00131     {
00132       allowed = (GuiWindow)(allowed | wnd);
00133       updateVisible();
00134     }
00135

00258        through script commands. You can manipulate this through using
00259        allow() and disableAll().
00260

00262        elements, but this is not done yet.
00263      */

00281 
00282   template<typename T>
00283   void WindowManager::removeDialog(T*& dialog)
00284   {
00285       OEngine::GUI::Layout *d = static_cast<OEngine::GUI::Layout*>(dialog);
00286       removeDialog(d);
00287       dialog = 0;
00288   }
